bug.short_desc: Conflict between validation error message and tooltip for a textfield

long_desc.thetext:
If a textfield has not been touched (null) or the field has been touched but is an empty string, the validation error message should not take presedence over the tooltip i.e. the tooltip is never shown. When the textfield is having a non-empty value the tooltip takes presedence over the validation error message.
The reasonable scenario should be:
1. untouched field (null) -> tooltip takes presedence over validation error message -> the user can read what is expected to be typed 2. touched field (empty string) -> validation error message takes presedence over tooltip -> message to the user that an empty string is not accepted 3. field with erroneous content -> validation error message takes presedence over tooltip -> message to the user that erroneous input is not accepted 4. field with validated truthy content -> tooltip takes presedence over validation error message -> message to the user if further input i.e. change of the current content of the field
Use case must be done here.
